meanings.definition: To make (something) sensitive to light, especially by the action of a photosensitizer.
meanings.sent1: The scientist photosensitized the film to capture the perfect image.
meanings.sent2: She photosensitized the paper before exposing it to sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The camera was so photosensitized that even a tiny ray of light made it click!
meanings.sent4: His mind was photosensitized to notice every detail in the bright room.
meanings.sent5: The flowers were photosensitized to bloom under the morning sun.

meanings.definition: Having an abnormal sensitivity to light.
meanings.sent1: The photosensitized skin needed protection from the sun's rays.
meanings.sent2: She wore sunglasses to shield her photosensitized eyes from the bright light.
meanings.sent3: The photosensitized cat preferred to nap in the shade to avoid the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His photosensitized skin turned red even on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The photosensitized plant wilted under the intense sunlight.
